main event: A series of flashes and explosions were observed and heard over a six-month period in Gambill, St. Lawrence Island, Alaska in 1951.
interesting points: The explosions caused the ground to vibrate.
The flashes were either on the shore or in the water.
The explosions were evaluated as gunfire from the shore.
Similar explosions were also reported in April, July, and August 1950.
Radar and visual observations did not confirm the presence of any objects.
